config.question: Why was it essential for Virginia and Maryland to have a constant flow of immigrants?

choices.content: The population constantly needed replacing due to high death rates and low birth rates.
Virginia and Maryland did not have many opportunities, so colonists moved to Florida.
Most immigrants brought with them needed supplies.
Salaries of the immigrants were lower than those of the earlier settlers.

answer_3.response: Most immigrants to the Chesapeake region died soon after arriving. It is difficult to ascertain the exact cause of death in most cases, but malaria and other diseases took a frightful toll.
